intro: Quintinia altigena, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Its flowers are borne in clusters and attract various pollinators, including birds and insects. Quintinia altigena is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardiness.
